Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell played hero over the weekend, scoring a go-ahead basket with 0.1 seconds left to give Cleveland a 114-113 win on Saturday night.
Pre-Game Insights: The Bucks have struggled to a 1-5 record to start the season, and they currently sport the worst record in the Eastern Conference.
Cleveland is atop the East and is one of just two remaining undefeated teams across the league.
The Cavaliers are 7.5-point home favorites as of Monday morning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Action tips off at 7:10pm ET when the Milwaukee Bucks take on the Cleveland Cavaliers.
All 30 teams are in action for Monday's jammed-packed NBA slate.
Others: The promotion is only open to individuals who are at least 21 years of age (18+ in D.C.) and are physically present in Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, the District of Columbia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana (excluding the following parishes: Caldwell, Catahoula, Franklin, Jackson, LaSalle, Sabine, Union, West Carroll and Winn), Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Vermont, Virginia, West Virginia, or Wyoming during the promotion period.
